A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I genuinely loved it and I look forward very much to repeated viewings! I think the movie did a really good job of effectively passing on the torch of maintaining the Resistance to the younger characters\, but I am very interested to see how they'll move forward without Carrie Fisher. I thought that Rey was particularly wonderful--she makes me think of Adam from \"Good Omens.\" She's an immensely important character who doesn't realize her own importance and\, I think\, being sort of on the outside of the Jedi and the Sith will help her realize whatever her place will be. I'd have liked a little more Finn\, but I loved the development  the movie gave him toward acts of real courage that he wasn't guilted or forced into taking. I do agree with the criticism that the kiss at the end feels a bit out of place\, but I felt like he and Rose had some really good chemistry and I'm not mad about it--I just think it could have been done a little differently. I enjoyed the more lighthearted moments. They reminded me of some of the better comedic beats from the original trilogy. I look forward to noticing more details in future re-watches!
